intro: Lellingeria guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste lellingeria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
